intro: Hemianemia luetzelburgii, commonly known as the Luetzelburg's hemianthus, is a rare aquatic plant belonging to the Hydrocharitaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, ribbon-like leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in width. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in the shaded areas of ponds and lakes. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually greenish-white and appear in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
